title: PyAssimp can't load simple OBJ

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Global flag to mark a deviation from expected behaviour

body:
Here's the error trace:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pyassimp/core.py", line 321, in load
    scene = _init(model.contents)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pyassimp/core.py", line 216, in _init
    call_init(obj, target)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pyassimp/core.py", line 84, in call_init
    _init(obj,parent=caller)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pyassimp/core.py", line 212, in _init
    setattr(target, name, obj)
AttributeError: 'bytes' object has no attribute 'aketrans'
```

This happens even on a simple cube:
```
# Blender v2.80 (sub 44) OBJ File: ''
# www.blender.org
mtllib cube.mtl
o Cube
v -1.000000 -1.000000 1.000000
v -1.000000 1.000000 1.000000
v -1.000000 -1.000000 -1.000000
v -1.000000 1.000000 -1.000000
v 1.000000 -1.000000 1.000000
v 1.000000 1.000000 1.000000
v 1.000000 -1.000000 -1.000000
v 1.000000 1.000000 -1.000000
vt 0.375000 0.000000
vt 0.625000 0.000000
vt 0.625000 0.250000
vt 0.375000 0.250000
vt 0.625000 0.500000
vt 0.375000 0.500000
vt 0.625000 0.750000
vt 0.375000 0.750000
vt 0.625000 1.000000
vt 0.375000 1.000000
vt 0.125000 0.500000
vt 0.125000 0.750000
vt 0.875000 0.500000
vt 0.875000 0.750000
vn -1.0000 0.0000 0.0000
vn 0.0000 0.0000 -1.0000
vn 1.0000 0.0000 0.0000
vn 0.0000 0.0000 1.0000
vn 0.0000 -1.0000 0.0000
vn 0.0000 1.0000 0.0000
usemtl None
s off
f 1/1/1 2/2/1 4/3/1 3/4/1
f 3/4/2 4/3/2 8/5/2 7/6/2
f 7/6/3 8/5/3 6/7/3 5/8/3
f 5/8/4 6/7/4 2/9/4 1/10/4
f 3/11/5 7/6/5 5/8/5 1/12/5
f 8/5/6 4/13/6 2/14/6 6/7/6
```

The error can be reproduced by saving that OBJ as "cube.obj" and running a docker image:
```
docker run -it --mount type=bind,source="$(pwd)",target=/models seekadventure/assimp bash

cd /models
python -c "import pyassimp; pyassimp.load('cube.obj')"
```
The docker repo description shows the Dockerfile: 
https://hub.docker.com/r/seekadventure/assimp


I tracked down the exact commit and line of code that introduce the error:
https://github.com/assimp/assimp/blob/0adc032f6983bc74f3556081c0b66f8fe874369d/port/PyAssimp/pyassimp/structs.py#L1088

Deleting that line resolves the error.
Unfortunately, I lack the understanding of assimp and python c types to find the correct solution.
